resources.string: One Time Setup: Copying stock animations to your SD card.
Please ensure Bluetooth pairing has been completed prior. The Bluetooth pairing code is: 4545."

First pair your Android device to the Pixel LED frame which will show up as 'IOIO' in Bluetooth using code 4545.

Tap an animation to display it on the Pixel LED frame.

Follow the instructions below to add your own animations which are in animated gif format to this app:

Connect your Android device to your computer with a USB cable.

From your computer, open your Android device and copy your animated gifs to the pixel/pixelanimate folder of your SD card or internal storage if your device does not have a removeable SD card.

After done copying, select Rescan from this app's menu

You can also delete the sample animated gifs leaving only your own.

You'll get the best results by pre-scaling your animated gifs to 32x32 resolution and using a solid black background.

Animated gifs not in 32x32 resolution will be scaled automatically to 32x32. Animated gifs higher than 500x500 resolution may cause this app to crash and therefore it is recommended to use animated gifs of 300x300 resolution or lower.
Only animations in the pixel/pixelinteractive directory of your SD card will be displayed. Checking this box displays all SD card pictures.
Normally you won\'t need to change this, only if you want to override the frames per second of the animations. Restart app after changing.
Shortcut to the Bluetooth settings screen. Pair to IOIO using code: 4545
Forces the app to be always on, your device will not go into power savings mode while this app is running. Good if using as a Kiosk for example.
Now scanning your SD card or internal memory for new animations or deletions, just a moment…
Copying stock animations to your SD card or internal memory…
After this completes, select Instructions from the menu to use your own animations
You\'re still in slide show mode, swipe from right to left to end the slide show and then you can select a single image
Displays debug messages, use to see how often the Bluetooth connections are getting disconnected and connected as well as other debug messages
Number of seconds the proximity triggered image is dispay before clearing
Delay in seconds to show the next image if the user is still standing in proximity sensor range
How many times per second the proximity sensor should poll
Minimum time in seconds to show the triggered proximity animation which will continue to run as long as the subject is standing within prox sensor range. 0 means no delay.
An image will display when the proximity sensor value falls between the lower and upper thresholds
An image will display when the proximity sensor value falls between the lower and upper thresholds
IOIO Pin number used for the proximity sensor input
Displays the proxmity sensor data, use to calibrate the proximity sensor and set your desired range. Restart the app after checking and unchecking this box.

Proximity sensor data is shown below, stand in front of PIXEL from the desired distance where you want the images to trigger.

Note that the proximity sensor has a limited range of around 30cm.

Then save this proximity range by entering the Prox Threshold Lower and Prox Threshold Upper setting values in this app's settings.

Uncheck the Show Prox Sensor Data box to get back to normal operation from this app's settings and then re-start this app.
